args:
A system in which the strong lead the
weak... The so-called ＂New Way of
Valkaheim＂ spread quickly throughout
the continent.
A system where strength could be used\nto the benefit of all was a good match for\nsouthern Grastaea at present.
The weak who tire of war and seek\nleadership, and the powerful who\nwould take the mantle of shepherds...
Leonidas created a society in which both\ngroups could live in symbiotic harmony.
Government has begun to function\nnot only in large cities, but in small\ntowns and villages as well.
Bit by steady bit, war-torn southern\nGrastaea began to show signs of recovery.
That's the island nation to the east, right?\nI didn't take you for a man of diplomacy.
We are still in the preparatory stages.\nUsing my brother's messenger, I am\nestablishing a line of communication.
Hrm. So the seventh scion's pretty good\nat statecrafty stuff, huh?
No. He has little interest in politics.\nBut he is hopelessly addicted to\nhelping people.
So you guys are like oil and water, then.
Aptly put. Though we were raised in the\nsame palace, at some point our paths\ndiverged.
Young Leonidas has been standing\nthere for quite some time now.
One hardly need wonder why. Given\nthis is his final farewell to his mother,\nI imagine it is difficult to leave the spot.
And the poor queen. To think she left to\noffer succor to a village ravaged by heavy\nrains only to be caught up in a tornado.

Honestly, these dragons! One would
hardly think a torrent of rain would NEED
be followed on by a powerful tornado,
and yet, they saw fit to make it so.
Aye, it is known the dragons who govern\nnature bring forth blessing and misfortune\nin equal measure.
But to think such a fate might befall the\nqueen of a nation so intrinsically tied to\nthe blood of those very dragons...
More to the point, you have asked after\nmy brother a great deal. Has your curiosity\ngotten the better of you?
I guess. I'd just like to know what kind\nof guy he is, given that he defeated you.
Though of course you're\nvery cool yourself, Leonidas!
Sorry, my boy here can be too\nstraightforward for his own good.
Anyway, Leonidas. We've appreciated\neverything you've done for us, but it's\nabout time we were on our way.
You taught me a lot about this era\nand helped me prepare for my journey.
And since I've left preparations to defeat\nElysium to you, in all your excellence...
We're going to try and chase after the\ndragon itself.
Hm? I thought its location was\nunknown to you.
It is, for now. But if I follow the trail\nof Elysium from a thousand years ago,\nI should be able to catch up.
I hit the books to see what happened in\nour world after we left it.

Meene, the faerie who raised me as
my mother and went on to become the
Goddess Ilia... I'm going to pursue her
and Elysium's footsteps.
A faerie, you say? So you head north.
Yep. Apparently, that's where the land of\nthe faeries lies. I think we'll head there\nfirst in search of clues.
I see. You may well come face-to-face\nwith my younger brother, then.
Yup. I'm looking forward to it.\nAnyway, see you around, green eyes.
Thank you, Leonidas.\nUntil we meet again.
(One that she may be freed from a\nfate ongoing...)
(The other that he may unearth the truth...)
(And I, so that I may free this world from\nthe invisible shackles that bind it.)
I am no longer a powerless man\nwho stands inert.
For myself, and for the world, I will\nmarch onward to fulfill my ambitions.
And I look forward to the day when our\npaths intersect once more...my brother.
